page.title: 18SETTLEMENTS IN OUR AREA
page.content: The name of every settlement whether hamlet,village,town or city has a meaning and in this area there are many small settlements. { Higher Upcott}was the home of John de Uppecot in 1275.{Abbeyford}means a ford near the abbey which used to be at{Brightley}in the 12th century. Misdon means 'Mist Hill'.{Misdon}used to be called Myston in 1345. Butterford is called by that name because of the colour of the water (yellow).{Down House}was called Downehowses in 1663.{Curworthy}was called Corneurde in{1086}and Cur means 'Hand Mill' and worthy means 'Farm', so{Curworthy}means'Handmill Farm'.{ {Brightley}was called Bristleghe in 1344 and{East Wood}means 'East of the Wood'. This area is characterised by Hamlets and Farms.
